nitf
Class IOHandle

java.lang.Object
  nitf.NITFObject
      nitf.DestructibleObject
          nitf.IOInterface
              nitf.NativeIOInterface
                  nitf.IOHandle

public final class IOHandle
extends NativeIOInterface

A representation of a handle to a file object.

This class provides access to a native file object, so it does not use the Java io library.

Field Summary
static int NITF_ACCESS_READONLY
          Opens the file with read-only privileges
static int NITF_ACCESS_READWRITE
          Opens the file for reading and/or writing
static int NITF_ACCESS_WRITEONLY
          Opens the file with write-only privileges
static int NITF_CREATE
          Creates a new file
static int NITF_OPEN_EXISTING
          Opens an existing file
static int NITF_TRUNCATE
          Truncates the file

          Creates a new IOHandle object for READING, using the file referenced from a parent pathname string; This sets the access flag to NITF_ACCESS_READONLY and the creation flag to NITF_OPEN_EXISTING

          Creates a new IOHandle object, using the file referenced from a parent pathname string and an access modifier.

Constructor Detail

IOHandle

public IOHandle(java.lang.String fileName)
         throws NITFException
Creates a new IOHandle object for READING, using the file referenced from a parent pathname string; This sets the access flag to NITF_ACCESS_READONLY and the creation flag to NITF_OPEN_EXISTING

Parameters:
fileName - the path of the file associated with this handle
Throws:
NITFException

IOHandle

public IOHandle(java.lang.String fileName,
                int accessFlag,
                int creationFlag)
         throws NITFException
Creates a new IOHandle object, using the file referenced from a parent pathname string and an access modifier.

Parameters:
fileName - the path of the file associated with this handle
accessFlag - options are NITF_ACCESS_READONLY, NITF_ACCESS_WRITEONLY, or NITF_ACCESS_READWRITE
creationFlag - options are NITF_CREATE, NITF_TRUNCATE, or NITF_OPEN_EXISTING
Throws:
NITFException
Method Detail

getFileName

public java.lang.String getFileName()
Return the name of the file associated with this handle

Returns:
the name of the file associated with this handle
